title: Dentistry Terms
description: Open wide for this quiz about the specialized vocabulary used by dental professionals.

questions.question: What is 'occlusion' in dentistry?
options: The way the upper and lower teeth come together when the mouth closes

questions.question: What does 'periodontal' refer to?
options: The inner part of a tooth
Relating to the structures surrounding and supporting the teeth, such as gums and bone

questions.question: What is a 'crown' in dental terminology?
options: A cap placed over a damaged tooth to restore its shape and function

questions.question: What does 'prophylaxis' mean in dentistry?
options: A professional cleaning procedure to prevent disease

questions.question: What is 'bruxism'?
options: The habitual grinding or clenching of teeth

questions.question: What does 'endodontic' treatment involve?
options: Treatment of the interior of the tooth, including root canals

questions.question: What is a 'dental bridge'?
options: A prosthetic device anchored to adjacent teeth that replaces one or more missing teeth
A walkway in a dental office

questions.question: What is 'calculus' in dental terms?
options: Hardened dental plaque that forms on teeth, also called tartar

questions.question: What does 'malocclusion' mean?
options: An improper alignment of the teeth when the jaw is closed

questions.question: What is 'gingivitis'?
options: Inflammation of the gums, often an early stage of gum disease

questions.question: What is the 'pulp' of a tooth?
options: The cement that holds a filling in place
The visible part of the tooth above the gum line
The soft tissue inside the tooth containing nerves and blood vessels

questions.question: What does 'impacted' mean when referring to a tooth?
options: A tooth that is blocked from fully emerging through the gum
A tooth that has been knocked out
A tooth with a very large filling

questions.question: What is an 'amalgam' in dentistry?
options: A silver-colored filling material made from a mixture of metals including mercury

questions.question: What does 'prosthodontics' focus on?
options: The design and fitting of artificial replacements for teeth and other parts of the mouth

questions.question: What is a 'veneer' in dentistry?
options: A sealant applied to children's teeth
A thin shell of porcelain or composite bonded to the front of a tooth to improve its appearance
